result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Socha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with V. Presswood unless specifically authorized by the family court order and supervising agent. No contact with females under the age of 18 unless specifically authorized by supervising agent.
Defendant to pay child support as ordered in the Outagamie County family court matter.

Defendant to comply with the Sex Offender Registration Program. Defendant may petition for removal from the program 15 years after completion of the sentence.  Complete a Sex Offender Treatment Assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Supervising Agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to huber privileges. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
***Based on correspondence from the Department of Corrections dated March 23, 2019, the Court amends the sentence credit to reflect 245 days credit for time served***
Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No. 2014CF000160

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with females under the age of 18 years of age unless in the immediate company of a parent or guardian.   Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the victim as named in the Complaint, V.P.

Defendant is to continue to comply with the Sex Offender Registration Program as previously ordered.  Complete a Sex Offender Treatment Assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the Supervising Agent.

Court Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid.  The defendant is ordered to authorize the Department of Corrections to collect from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account, an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable for payment of court costs.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days of release or re-establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 14CF-160 and 15CF-66 - Both Cases Called @ 11:05 AM: Defendant Justin J. Socha in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel admit receipt of Rev Order and Warrant.  Counsel stipulated to TS credit.  Counsel believe that absent being mention in Rev Packet - concurrent SEH to be imposed.  15CF-66 Chapter 950 in compliance.  Based upon significant efforts made by the State to contact victim - Chapter 950 compliance does in fact exist and also as to 14CF-160.  Argument by DA Blader as to SEH.  Argument by SPD Szilagyi SEH.  Statement by Def: Yes prepared written statement read.  The Court:  14CF-160:  3 yr bifurcated SEH - 1 yrs IC/2 yrs ES.  248 days TS credit.  15CF-66:  7 yr bifurcated SEH.  3 yrs IC/4 yrs ES.  244 days TS credit.   Conditions of ES:  Complete SOT, N/C with any females under 18 yrs unless in the immediate company of parent or guardian;   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Rest that remains owing as to 14CF-160 - DOC is authorized to collect from inmate earnings in a reasonable amount percentage as determined by DOC; unclear if Rest remains owing as to 15CF-66.  SOR to continue as previously ordered; No Contact with 15CF-66 victim V.P.; Costs reimposed.  Court believes Def is ineligible for both SAP/CIP due to charge.  If not statutorily ineligible for SAP and CIP, the Court would authorize entry into those programs if the Department finds it appropriate, Court will allow entry into same.  Appeal Rights Given.
Character Letter from Raquel Wagner
Character letter from J. Woodhill
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 11, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Case Called @ 1:00 PM: Defendant Justin J. Socha in court, in custody, appears via video.  Ruth Ann Zouski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Corp Counsel - Def is behind for March and April with no response to two reminder letters sent.  Payment plan to recommence once released from 6 mos WC Jail sentence.  Statement by Defendant.  Court finds basis exists for contempt.  Imposes 90 days WCJ - Stayed - Purge:  Commencing on 5/1/2017 and continuing w/o interruption Def must maintain a payment of $100 per month until fully paid.   If a single payment is missed jail sentence to be served.

Case called @ 3:06 p.m. Defendant Justin J. Socha in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Justin J. Socha in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to 3rd Degree Sexual Assault of a Child contrary to Wis Stat 940.225(3).  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 4 years probation. Conditions: 6 mos WC Jail - Huber, No GT, 58 days CFTS, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, NC w/ V. Presswood unless specifically authorized by custody/placement order and supervising agent, NC w/ female children under the age of 18 unless specifically authorized by supervising agent, DE to pay child support as ordered in the Outagamie County family court matter, DE to register as a sex offender - DE may petition the Court for the removal of SO registration 15 years after completion of the sentence, DE to complete SOT, Costs to include $500 extradition fees w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
B.P.
V.P.
State's
Wisconsin Lock & Load Prisoner Transports LLC Invoice - $500.00
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-02-2015 03:00 pm

Case called @ 2:03 p.m. Defendant Justin J. Socha in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Justin J. Socha in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The court entertains waiver preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Initial appearance at 10-23-2015 02:00 pm
Defendant is prohibited from having contact with any females under the age of 18 unless they are in the presence of a parent or guardian.

Case called @ 1:02 p.m. Defendant Justin J. Socha in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting Sig Bond. Court orders $1000 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
